result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Victor Bolivar Sarango Medina

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Victor Bolivar Sarango Medina
Current: 66 Terresa St, Roberts, WI 54023 United States  (Effective: 10-20-2022)
Prior: 573 Cth J, Apt. 2, Roberts, WI 54023

2:59 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Victor Bolivar Sarango Medina. Defendant Victor Bolivar Sarango Medina in court, in custody, Interpreter Monica Marin appeared by Zoom. INCLUDES 14CT133 and 15CF45. Court notes Interpreter still under oath from previous hearing in 15CF45. Court notes DE is on PO hold on 14CT133 and there is information that DE previously served jail sanction. State moves to dismiss 15CF45 with prejudice and reopen 14CT133 and resentence. ADA Ellenwood gives sentencing recommendation.  Atty. Dolfi agrees to resolution. Court dismisses 15CF45 with prejudice. Court vacates order for probation in 14CT133, ratifies other portion of sentence. Court finds 10 days jail have been served. Remaining portions of sentence in 14CT133 remain in effect including fine, IID, and blood draw fee, to also include DE to serve 10 day jail sanction with credit for 10 days. DE to be released from custody once probation hold is lifted. JA to notify probation to lift probation hold. Bail in 15CF45 no longer exists. Adjourned: 3:09 PM. kma
Status conference on October 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Per EFV. fax: Dispatch, Jail and SCSO. arc

1:01 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephanie Schmidt in court. Defendant Victor Bolivar Sarango Medina in court, in custody. Interpreter Monica Marin in Court. Sworn Interpreter. Court reviews case. ADA Ellenwood requests explanation on non appearance. Atty Schmidt states DE was deported and returned 1 month ago. Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond arguments. Court quashed warrant. Court sets PTC with RMW. Interpreter confirmed in court. Adjourned 01:44PM Back on Record 01:46 PM. DE is on a PO Hold. PO hold out of St. Croix County. Adjourned 01:50 PM 
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Signed by RMW on 9/1/2020. c: DA and Atty via e-file. km

Extradite          RMW signed 6/11/15 - c: DA & SCSO. hml
Hearing on July 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.

CO: RMW; REP: Drost; CLERK: Liddle. ADA: Francis Collins    DF ATTY:  Shirlene Renee Perrin   DF:  Victor Bolivar Sarango Medina did not appear. Case called at 9:33 a.m. Atty Perrin states that the defendant has been deported to Equador. ADA Collins will try to get documentation on this matter and requesting a continuation and a warrant. Court will issue a warrant. hml  Hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.

from Atty. Perrin requesting to appear by phone for the arraignment. Per TCH on 04-17-2015, "approved". gme
filed by ADA Kevin Gehler. eif
Pre-trial conference on June 11, 2015 at 08:45 am.

CO: Commissioner Heckmann REP: Erin Drost Clerk: Liddle. ADA:  Kevin H. Gehler   DF ATTY:  Shirlene Renee Perrin appears via phone. Interpreter: Monica Marin in person.   DF:  Victor Bolivar Sarango Medina appeared from jail. S/T Monica Marin. Information filed.  Court informs Def if charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Atty Perrin enters NG on both counts. Waives speedy trial demand. Would like to address bond. ADA Gehler makes statement. No objection to a signature bond. Current ICE hold on defendant. Court will convert cash bond to $1,000 signature bond. hml  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:45 am.
Arraignment on April 17, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

CO: Judge Richards for HWC, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Liddle. ADA: Kevin Gehler   DF ATTY:  Shirlene Renee Perrin   DF:  Victor Bolivar Sarango Medina appeared from jail. Interpreter Monica Marin. Case called at 12:03 p.m. ADA Gehler makes statement. S/T Interpreter Monica Marin. ADA Gehler calls Deputy Resong to the stand. S/T Deputy Monica Resong with the St Croix County Jail. ADA Gehler directs. Deputy identifies defendant in the courtroom. Atty Perrin cross directs Deputy Resong. Requesting video recordings be reserved from December. Court grants request. State offers Exhibit #1 (JOC). O/R Exhibit #1. Deputy excused. Court will find probable cause and bind defendant over for trial. State does not have information ready today. Set arraignment for tomorrow at 1 p.m. hml  Arraignment scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Appointing Atty Perrin. km
Per CAR 4/13/15 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif
Preliminary hearing on April 16, 2015 at 11:45 am.

CO: CAR,  RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes,  Interpreter Monica Marin, DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Victor Bolivar Sarango Medina appeared from jail. Interpreter sworn in. Court confirms address.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Atty Kucinski believes the complaint is defective and reserves. ADA Nieskes request speedy prelim and a cash bond. Defendant did report on 12/23/14 but no one spoke english and Defendant left (7 dyas remaining).   QUASH WARRANT.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 11:45 am.
Defendant in custody. eif
